items.name: Potter's Cafe @ Petaling Jaya
items.description: Cakes, coffee and tea in a friendly art gallery, discreetly tucked away from the urban bustle: Potter's Cafe is one of PJ's pleasant little secrets t...

items.name: Taketei
items.description: Taman Desa's latest spot for Japanese soul food mainly tackles ramen - the Jiro Ramen (RM16.00++; add RM5.30++ for chashu) might not exactly be the m...

items.name: Flower Girl Coffee
items.description: Springtime has come for restaurant enthusiasts at Sunway Geo Avenue, where many new eateries have sprouted recently. Flower Girl Coffee specialises in feel-good food - egg enthusiasts might especially be enticed by thick, tantalising omelettes, complemented by smoked salmon and a choice of spinach (RM18.80) or beetroot (RM20.80), avocado toast with poached egg (RM15.80; add RM2 for halloumi cheese), and chicken schnitzel with poached egg and coleslaw (RM21.80). Fairly solid stuff.

items.name: Siu G Jai
items.description: Siu yuk satay is the novelty here - skewers of crunchy, meaty roast pork, complemented by a spicy peanut dipping sauce, onions and cucumbers.

items.name: Roshona Bilash
items.description: Bangladeshi cooking secures a boost at Roshona Bilash, thronged mainly by migrant workers in a testament to the authenticity of its fare.

items.name: Lily's Homemade
items.description: Fans of chunky sausages might want to check out Lily's Homemade, which prides itself primarily on products independently made with premium pork, free of nasty chemicals, growth hormones and antibiotics.

items.name: The Bloom
items.description: A pleasant hideout amid the hubbub of Puchong.

items.name: Three X Co
items.description: Three X Co ranks among Bangsar's friendliest bars, spearheaded by three buddies - Daniel, Eugene and Wai Hung - in collaboration with one of KL's top mixologists, David Hans.

items.name: Lee Ji
items.description: A taste of Perak: Lee Ji's top specialities include classic Ipoh hor fun(RM12.

items.name: Smoking Skeleton
items.description: This coffee stand may currently sport a bare-bones selection - sit down for an espresso or take away a flat white - but the bevy of barista tournament trophies on the counter signals that this Skeleton has skills to burn.

items.name: Food by Fat Cat
items.description: The big dogs are romping into Sunway Geo Avenue: Food by Fat Cat feels purr-fect for a cheerful lunch, marking a new collaboration between Jaya Grocer and the culinary team behind Damansara Uptown's popular cafes The Good Batch and Nara Kitchen & Co

items.name: Divers Hideout Cafe
items.description: A massive, menacing shark mural ushers customers into KL's first diving-themed cafe, its interior bedecked in the ocean's undulating blue

items.name: Menya Kotetsu
items.description: Ramen addicts, add Menya Kotetsu to your list of destinations: The speciality here is the spicy miso ramen topped with Hokkaido-style zangi - two very chunky slices of crunchy, thickly battered chicken thigh meat, juicy with hints of a soy, ginger and garlic marinade

items.name: I Love Pho
items.description: The first Malaysian spin-off of Melbourne's I Love Pho (with branches in Richmond, Abbotsford and Melbourne Emporium) has landed at Mutiara Damansara's IPC Shopping Centre.
